result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward D. Shutes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward D. Shutes

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice - Unable to Forward per USPS
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

10:00 AM cases 22CF510, 22CT160, 22CM350, 22TR3022 called. Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Edward D. Shutes. Defendant Edward D. Shutes appeared by phone. Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant waives right to personal appearance, Court accepts waiver. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant waives right to a jury trial. 


22CM350: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription Repeater. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

22CF510: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Identity Theft-Financial Gain. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Defendant makes statement.

22CF510: Court withholds sentence and orders 2 years probation, 90 days jail stayed pending further order of the court with Huber and Electronic Monitoring if available. 
Conditions of probation:
Costs
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Restitution in 22CF510 of $214.00 plus 10% surcharge
2 days of jail credit if revoked.

22CM350: Court orders costs, provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 

Remaining charges are dismissed and read in including 22CT160 and 22TR3022.
Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Refused, Unable to Forward (Inmate not here)
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

(9:00 AM cases 22CT160, 22CM350, 22CF510 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Edward D. Shutes appeared by video. Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Edward D. Shutes. Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Attorney Patek enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts in all cases, which the Court accepts.
Attorney Patek requests to schedule a Status Conference.
Status Conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10 am.

Conditions:
No contact with J.H. or his residence.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
Not to use/possess anyone else's personal identifying documents/information.
Covers: 22CF510, 22CT160, 22CM350
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:37 AM cases 22CT160, 22CF510 and 22CM350 called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Edward D. Shutes in court, in custody with Attorney Zebulon Patek. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Branch 2 for scheduling Arraignment.

9:56 AM cases 22CF510, 22CM350, 22CT160 called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Edward D. Shutes not in court, in custody.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Edward D. Shutes.
Hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:17 AM cases 21CT160 22CM350 and 22CF510 called. Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Edward D. Shutes appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Zeb Patek. 
Defense waives reading of all complaints and time limits for the preliminary hearing in felony file. 
Defense updates their address with the courts. Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 5/23/22 at 3:30 PM. 
Return to court: 6/15/22 at 9:30 AM.
Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
